column1: Gorbadoc "Broadbelt" Brandybuck was a Hobbits of the Shire.
Gorbadoc was the son of Marmadoc Brandybuck and after his fathers death in

column2: and had in all seven children: Rorimac Brandybuck
Jim Allan suggested that the Celtic-sounding name Gorbadoc is "a slight alteration of Wikipedia:Gorboduc or Gorbodugu"
column3: a fictional pre-Roman king of the Britons.Jim Allan
column6: the publication of The Return of the Shadow confirmed that J.R.R. Tolkien had indeed used the name Gorboduc in four extant manuscript versions.

column1: His name Broadbelt derives from his generous table and waistline.Robert Foster
